snippet: Bismark Lithgow, 26, faces a maximum of 25 years to life in prison for stabbing his girlfriend 38 times and hiding her body in a plastic barrel in his bedroom in Harlem.
abstract: Harlem man Bismark Lithgow is convicted of second-degree murder in 2013 fatal stabbing of his girlfriend Francis Alfonso Pellerano.
lead_paragraph: Bismark Lithgow, 26, faces a maximum of 25 years to life in prison for stabbing his girlfriend 38 times and hiding her body in a plastic barrel in his bedroom in Harlem.

headline.main: Harlem Man Is Convicted of Murdering His Girlfriend
headline.print_headline: Man Convicted of Murdering His Girlfriend
